content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 25 Sep 2018Do you think investing in ETFs or SSB is better?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent
Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 25 Sep 2018Depends on your risk appetite, SSB for low risk and ETFs for medium risk. You can consider investing in both to diversify0 comments1

Jay Liu, Sleepyhead at Land of Dreams Level 6. MasterAnswered on 25 Sep 2018To each of its own. Want less risky go for SSB but around 2.5% return/issue. Depending on issue. Only default will be if government defaulted. ETFs will be riskier, following market conditions. There will be dividends(if applicable) and capital gains. 0 comments1

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 25 Sep 2018If you are young with no or little responsibility and willing to take some risk, go for 80%ETFs and put like 20% in SSB. If you scared, then put SSB. You can even put 100% in ETF if you dare since its your money. You have to google and do some research to see which suits you.0 comments1
